attributes.action: Limit noise omissions from traffic exhausts.
attributes.additional_details: Spike loud noises effect everyone, Europe wide, exhaust pipe noises, mainly aftermarket fitted can reach 90 DB, as loud as a police siren , or standing on a runway, it penetrates into dwellings  with no dilution where people are relaxing, kids sleeping and people just want to have a quit time in the garden.
attributes.background: Put a noise level check in the MOT test add ten pounds to the test , put large taxes on over limit machine, give police stopping power to check noise output, administer fines..

rejection.details:
Testing centres are already required to inspect a car’s exhaust system to ensure it does not breach legal noise limits as part of the MOT: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/car-parts-checked-at-an-mot/car-parts-checked-at-an-mot.

It is also illegal for cars to be modified to make their exhausts louder: https://www.gov.uk/noise-pollution-road-train-plane#:~:text=It's%20illegal%20to%20modify%20the,that%20creates%20too%20much%20noise.

You could start a petition calling for the legal noise limit for cars to be reduced from the current 74dB, as a way of tackling noisy exhausts, if that is something you'd like to happen.
